page.title: List of The Adventures of Tintin characters

rev.diff:
Line 261: Line 261:
==Sophocles Sarcophagus==
==Sophocles Sarcophagus==
â
:In French: [[:fr:PhilÃ©mon Siclone]]
+
Sophocles Sarcophagus is an [[absent-minded professor|absent-minded]] [[Egyptologist]] in search of the tomb of the [[Pharaoh]] Kih-Oskh whom Tintin meets on a cruise ship at the beginning of ''[[Cigars of the Pharaoh]]''. At this stage he is already a bit of an eccentric: rowing a boat, unaware that it is not even in the water; saying goodbye to Snowy the dog as if he was a little boy; and bumping into things and people.
Sophocles Sarcophagus is an [[absent-minded professor|absent-minded]] [[Egyptologist]] in search of the tomb of the [[Pharaoh]] Kih-Oskh whom Tintin meets on a cruise ship at the beginning of ''[[Cigars of the Pharaoh]]''. At this stage he is already a bit of an eccentric: rowing a boat, unaware that it is not even in the water; saying goodbye to Snowy the dog as if he was a little boy; and bumping into things and people.
